medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until approximately 4 years earlier when paresthesias of both feet, weakness of the lower legs, and bilateral foot drop developed gradually. Symptoms worsened over time, with increasing weakness in the legs and arms and the development of intermittent stabbing pain in the lower legs.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (CIDP) diagnosed 4 years earlier. The patient had a history of knee surgery and erectile dysfunction for the past year. He also had dyslipidemia and hypercholesterolemia controlled by diet.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lived with his wife and children, rarely consumed alcohol, and did not smoke. He was a businessman and used leg braces and a walker to ambulate.
